hero.title: Panic Button + Emergency Crowdsourcing, without compromising privacy.
hero.desc: Lowuder helps people report critical incidents safely, verifies them with AI and a crowd score, then alerts nearby users with a 1-km SMS blast.
hero.note: * For safety, public locations are always blurred using a radius.

mock.title: Lowuder Panic
mock.desc: Example screen: send a report with a photo, EXIF is removed automatically and location is jittered.

privacy.title: Privacy by Default
privacy.desc: EXIF stripping on media, geo-jitter for public users.

heatmap.title: Safe Heatmap
heatmap.desc: Radius map—no exact public pins; only authorized officers see details.

sms.title: Radius SMS Blast
sms.desc: If crowd score ≥ threshold, a 1-km SMS is sent to nearby users.

contacts.title: Emergency Contacts
contacts.desc: If not validated, send private SMS to user contacts first.

audit.title: Audit Trail
audit.desc: Pending → Soft-Verified → Verified with decision logs.

how.title: How Lowuder works
how.subtitle: Concise, auditable, and resilient to provocations.

1.title: User taps PANIC
1.desc: App removes EXIF, jitters location, then sends event.

2.title: Server verifies
2.desc: AI moderation: dedup, 1-km/10-min clustering, toxicity detection.

3.title: Status & Gate
3.desc: Pending → (Confirm/Dispute) → Soft-Verified/Verified based on crowd score.

4.title: Information distribution
4.desc: If threshold met: 1-km SMS blast. Else: private SMS + “needs confirmation” push.

5.title: Heatmap
5.desc: Public sees radius/heatmap; authorized officers can access details.

faq.title: Frequently asked questions
faq.a1: For public, we always use heatmaps and geo-jitter. Only authorized officers can view details if necessary.
faq.a2: AI moderation, media hash deduplication, and crowd score help filter invalid reports.
faq.q3: Can the SMS blast be configured?
faq.a3: Yes—thresholds, radius and quiet hours can be customized per community.
faq.a4: Yes. Officers can monitor clusters, status history and area statistics.
